subject: Re: [PATCH v4 25/25] docs: fuse: add io-uring bufring and zero-copy documentation

reviews.author: Joanne Koong (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Joanne Koong clarified that zero-copying in fuse is done through registered buffers, not kernel-managed buffer rings (kmbufs), and that kmbufs are used for non-zero-copyable payloads to minimize memory footprint.

reviews.author: Caleb Mateos
reviews.summary: Caleb Mateos pointed out a logical inconsistency in the io_uring implementation, specifically how io_uring_fixed_index_get() and io_uring_fixed_index_put() work.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Bernd Schubert reviewed several patches in the series, providing minor feedback and suggestions for improvement. He requested a sanity check in fuse_copy_do() or fuse_copy_fill(), pointed out an unused flag that could be used instead of adding new code, and noted a missing 'if bl' condition. Additionally, he asked for clarification on the 'buf_group' parameter in io_uring/kbuf: add buffer ring pinning/unpinning.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about initialization of cs->len in fuse_copy_fill and pointed out an inconsistency in the code for recycling kernel-managed buffer rings.

reviews.author: Christoph Hellwig
reviews.summary: Christoph Hellwig suggested splitting the series into smaller ones for easier review, raised several technical concerns about specific patches, and asked for documentation on uapi.

reviews.author: Askar Safin
reviews.summary: The reviewer questioned whether the kernel-managed buffer rings (kbufs) solve the same problem as splice, and referenced a quote from Linus Torvalds in 2006 to support their claim.
